text: Hermann Plaskuda (6 April 1879 - 21 March 1918) was a German fencer. He competed in four events at the 1912 Summer Olympics. He was killed in action during World War I. ==See also== * List of Olympians killed in World War I ==References== Category:1879 births Category:1918 deaths Category:German male fencers Category:Olympic fencers of Germany Category:Fencers at the 1912 Summer Olympics Category:German military personnel killed in World War I
title: Hermann Plaskuda
